text: The pale orb.

A tiny bedroom. Priest's. cell. Spare. Moody shadows from the window. A large cross on the wall. THE SENTINEL lies on a bed. He is an ancient old man. His eyes flicker, cloud over... Slowly, he expires. HIS HAND: as he dies, the Sentinel's hand siowly opens, revealing an ornate black box -- sealed -- like a miniatu coffin, which slips between his lifeless fingers... THE FLOOR: as the ornate box lands on the hard wood...
SUPERIMPOSE MAIN TITLES. “PRINCE OF DARKNESS".

An idyllic campus. Charming ivy-covered buildings. STUDEN stroll the grounds. PAN WITH a PRETTY CO-ED on a bicycle to REVEAL: BRIAN MARSH, 24, a graduate student in physics, newly arrived on campus, walks down a sunlit courtyard carrying ah -armload of’ textbooks. He glances over... BRIAN'S POV: near a fountain. CATHERINE MIDWOOD, 24, talk with another FEMALE GRADUATE STUDENT. They seem to be telling each other jokes, laughing. Catherine is pretty. Open. Intelligent. Tomboyish, in a way. CLOSE ON Brian as he slows, watches... HIS POV: Catherine walking away with her friend... And Brian can't resist looking over his shoulder at this beautiful girl as he enters 'The Feynman Institute of oe Physics'...
BLACK SCREEN. Continue MAIN TITLES.

The door opens an a NUN, 50s, appears. She steps inside the tiny cell... HER POV: the Sentinel lying still as death in his bed... The Nun says something m.o.s., gets no response. Then she looks down... HER POV: that ornate box lying on the floor... AN HOUR LATER: THE PRIEST, 50s, leans over a small table in the corner of the Sentinel's room. He is a strong- willed man, his eyes direct, humorless. In b.g. the Nun watches as the priest reads... PRIEST'S POV: an old weatherbeaten notebook. At the top of the yellowed page is written: “Brotherhood of Sleep". The priest reads on, his brow furrowing... PRIEST'S POV: EXTREME CLOSE-UP. In the middle of a page of handwriting, see the phrases: "...the sleeper wakes... and, right below, "...can no longer keep..."

PROFESSOR HOWARD DIRAC, 50s, a theoretical physicist, wal across campus carrying his briefcase. Dirac is of Chinese ancestry, a determined-looking man. He glances around at the students going to their classes... LOW ANGLE: we see Dirac walking toward the physics buildi in b.g. In f£.g.-is a mound of grass, and under the brigh green grass and leaves see thousands of ants scurrying madly... Dirac stops at the entrance to the physics building. He glances up into the morning sky... DIRAC'S POV: a strange alignment in the early morning sky The moon is visible directly above the sun... [EFFECT] BLACK SCREEN. More TITLES.
A beautiful expanse. Trees. Green lawns. The priest shakes hands with a BISHOP and ARCHBISHOP, two berobed luminaries of the Roman Catholic Church. (CONTINUED)

The three men talk m.o.s. Out of doors, on the quiet grounds, it's private here, somehow -- among the flowers. They are serious. Intent. Out of his pocket the priest brings something to show them... THE PRIEST'S HAND: the ornate box. He opens it, and insid is a large silver key... BLACK SCREEN. Continue MAIN TITLES.

Professor Dirac is lecturing to a graduate physics class. The class is small. The brightest of the bright. There's WALTER, 30s, Chinese. KELLY, 20s, pretty and outgoing. MULLINS, 30s. FIVE OTHER STUDENTS listen, take notes...

Let's talk about our beliefs and what we can learn about them... We believe nature is solid and time is constant. Matter has substance, time a direction. There is truth in flesh and solid ground. The wind may be invisible, but it's real. Smoke and fire, water and light -- they're different, not as stone nor steel, but they're tangible... Now we see Brian sitting near the back, not paying all th much attention to the lecture, looking at: BRIAN'S POV: Catherine, sitting a few rows in front. She listens attentively, taking notes... Brian does stare somewhat dreamily at her...

And we assume time has an arrow. It is as a clock -- one second is one second for _everyone. Cause precedes effect. Fruit rots, water flows downstream, we're born, we age, we die. The reverse never happens. A beat as Dirac pauses, a slight smile... (CONTINUED)
None of this is true. Say goodbye to classical reality, because our logic collapses on the subatomic level -- into ghosts and shadows...

The priest stands in front of a huge abandoned church somewhere in Los Angeles. It is immense. Gothic. Its spires sweep upward into the sky. The priest looks at the old abandoned church with a sense of unease...

A large, dusty hallway. The priest walks slowly along. His FOOTSTEPS ECHO. It's eerie. in here, the sunlight drifting in large, high windows. Now the priest stops at a huge iron door. Extremely old. Mammoth. It looks bomb-proof, earthquake-proof, other Act of-God proof... The priest pauses a moment by the iron door. Then he take out that ornate box, removes the key, inserts it in the l BLACK SCREEN - More TITLES.

Brian walks along. He slows, looks over... BRIAN'S -POV:. Catherine enters the university book store Brian stops. Glances at his watch. Parks himself by a bench to wait. He looks up... BRIAN'S POV: the night sky. Huge full moon. Leaves of a nearby tree swish silently in f.g. [EFFECT} Brian now looks over... BRIAN'S POV: Catherine comes out of the book store with a HANDSOME MAN, 27. They laugh and talk. He could be a student, a teacher, athlete , who knows? Hard to tell if they're just friends or on a more intimate basis... (CONTINUED)
Brian. He looks somewhat disappointed. But he's not sure either...

The priest is writing at a table-top computer. He is tense, driven. He finishes typing, punches a couple buttons, and the printer begins CLACKING madly as it type out what he's written... PRIEST'S POV: the printer. An address CLICKS across the page: "Professor Howard Dirac, Feynman Institute of Physi CLOSE ON the priest: he has a distant expression. EXTREME CLOSE-UP: the paper, as the printing element SNAP across: "...of the utmost urgency..." BLACK SCREEN. TITLES.
Dirac is lecturing again...

From Job's friends insisting that the good are rewarded and the wicked punished, down to scientists in the 1930s proving, to their horror, a theorem that not everything can be proved, we've sought to impose order on the universe... Brian's not paying attention during this lecture either. He. looks at... BRIAN'S POV: Catherine, who listens interestedly...

But we've found something very surprising. While order does exist in the universe, it is not at all what we had in mind... Now Brian glances over at the windows letting in that war California sunlight... BRIAN'S POV: a black limousine pulls up in front of the physics building. It's ominous somehow, that big black car against the verdant green of the campus...
—, Sf f

After class. Graduate students wander out of the lecture hall. Catherine comes out, walks by CAMERA. a beat later, stops, watches her... Brian exits BRIAN'S POV: Catherine walking away down the hall... Brian. He's definitely in love. sees... Or close to it. BRIAN'S POV: a MOTHER SUPERIOR walking down the hall, passing Catherine, coming this way... MEDIUM SHOT: Brian, as Dirac emerges from the lecture hal passes Brian and moves o.s. BRIAN'S POV: as Dirac is met by the Mother Superior. talk m.o.s. -- they're just far enough out of earshot. the Mother Superior hands Dirac a sealed envelope... Brian, as Waiter drifts over to him...
(sotto voce) What's this?
I don't know. Dirac did that series of debates on the B.B.C. a few years ago...
Oh, with the priest, right...
Maybe they're planning another one... BLACK SCREEN. MORE TITLES.

A car pulls up in front. of a California Spanish mission. Dirac emerges from the car. Walks up some steps into a portico. Looks off... DIRAC'S POV: a group of NUNS walking, their robes billowe by the wind, their habits fluttering...
(CONTINUED)
o™ i }
at Behind Dirac the priest walks out of the mission, comes up to him. They shake hands, talk m.o.s. They seem happy to see each other, renewing an old acquaintance.

Dirac and the priest enter an ornate sanctuary inside the mission. They move away from CAMERA and now the priest tells Dirac something m.o.s. We don't hear, but Dirac is absolutely stunned by what the priest is saying. Alarmed. Then nonplussed. +e te CLOSER ANGLE, to hear...
He died before his appointment with the Cardinal -- but he left a diary... The priest hands Dirac the notebook...
You've got to help us... Please. Dirac searches the priest's expression, finds only fear.. BLACK SCREEN. TITLES.

Spartan. Spare. Lots of books stacked around. A messy bed. Brian sits at a desk, shuffling a deck of cards. He' practicing a magic trick, making a card disappear in his hand. | But he's bad at it, and the card keeps dropping o onthe desk. Frustrated, he glances up now at an old TV set with its sound turned down... BRIAN'S POV: TV. The news is on and the ANCHOR is talking m.0.8. SUPERIMPOSED OVER is the legend: "NEW DISCOVERY". Then we see a photograph of a distant galaxy, and we ZOOM IN on a glowing, exploding star -- a supernova... SHOOTING OVER THE TV on Brian as he comes up to the set, turns up the sound, returns to the desk... (CONTINUED)
REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/97

(v.0.) ++. took place in pre~Cambrian times, and scientists say the light from this stellar explosion is just now reaching us across the vast gulf of space... NOW CAMERA BOOMS DOWN... and across the back of the IV set are thousands of ants racing around madly 9} on 1 the ‘surface...
as Dirac and the priest step from a limousine and walk to the old crumbling church...
The priest and Dirac step in to the dilapidated front hal move past some stairs to a hallway...
They come to that massive iron door. The priest inserts the silver key...
+.+ and the iron door swings open on to a long stone stai way that leads downward. There are no windows in here. Th priest turns on a flashlight and leads Dirac down...
They come off the stairway into an old, crumbling hallway Unlike the church upstairs, it resembles some ornate old catacombs. CAMERA MOVES WITH them down the hall...
Who knew about this?
Only members of this forgotten sect. The Brotherhood of Sleep.
31 32 33 34 35 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87
Now they move down a dank corridor. Dark. Water drips from above. The priest's flashlight beam spins around the walls. They seem to be going deeper and deeper...
This was built in the 1500s. The altar was moved here from England. Before England, it was in Rome...
The Vatican didn't know?

The guardian priest would keep the secret, and before he died would pass it on to another... They turn a corner... into a strange hallway. There are crosses on the stone walls. Everywhere. The small hall s wet, ancient. Dirac and the priest stop, and CAMERA MOVES IN, PANS, and we see they are standing in a mezzani over looking a huge underground church built deep in the bowels of the earth under the abandoned church above... Now see something glowing in the apse -- a weird yellow glow... It's a container of some kind...
BLACK SCREEN. Final TITLE.

Dirac and the priest enter the underground church. It is moist, dripping in here. There are literally hundreds of crosses everywhere -- on the walls, on stanchions, on the floor. The priest lights a few candles. Dirac is clearly stunned. They start down the aisle toward the front, CAMERA MOVING WITH THEM. Dirac stares ahead. The priest looks anxious, almost frightened... (CONTINUED)
ee ee ae

DIRAC'S POV: we MOVE TOWARD a large transparent canister of liguid in the apse. All the crosses seem to point toward this canister as if some sort of evil were being held at bay. It is sealed with a heavy, screw-on lid. It looks vastly old. Dirac and the priest walk, the flashlight beam spinning, staring... DIRAC'S POV: MOVE IN CLOSE on the canister. The mold and corrosion on the top and bottom of the canister look pre- historic. Inside the sealed compartment there is a weird water dance -- the liquid, a faint yellowish color, glows and swirls -- somehow alive! Dirac and the priest stop in front of the canister. The priest lights several candles. Below the canister is an 1d book on a podium. The priest carefully opens the book, shines the flashlight on its yellowed pages...
Latin.
The original text has been distorted through the years...
Distorted?
Rewritten. Changed. Dirac leans forward, gingerly examines the book...

It's been written on two or three times and improperly erased. You see -~ the original text is still visible -- underneath. Dirac looks back up at the strangely glowing canister. Th priest stares at it, too. There's an unmistakable look on their faces -- dread, fear...
Can you feel it?
Yes... Something... (CONTINUED)
ll.
It was never there before. It started a month ago...
What started?
A change -~ in the earth and sky... His power...
Catherine and Walter walk together on their way to class. CAMERA MOVES ALONG with them...
I don't get it.
What don't you get?
The whole thing. It doesn't make sense.
It violates common sense, that's the whole point. That's what Einstein couldn't accept.
I can't accept it either. (beat) Do you know anything about Spontaneous Human Combustion?
Walter, come on... Schrodinger's Cat...
I know, I know... (CONTINUED)
o~
So, what's the point? The point is, until the cat is observed by someone, he is not in any definite state, alive or dead. He is in a wave superposition state, both dead and alive at the same time...
Huh?
Only when we open the box and observe the cat does he material- ize into reality, either dead or alive...
But it doesn't make sense...
That's the entire, complete point. It doesn't make any common sense, our common sense breaks down on the subatomic level.
Why do I want a Ph.D. in this?
Particle beam weapons, research grants...
A-millionaire when I'm 40 -- now I remember...

Catherine and Walter walk down the hall... CATHERINE'S POV: MOVING SHOT of Brian leaning against the wall opposite the door to the lecture room. He's looking back at her. Only two of the other students from Dirac's class are here ~- Kelly and Mullins... Catherine smiles at Brian as she and Walter stop at the lecture hall door, stare at a note taped there... (CONTINUED)
You're not going to like it... THEIR POV: the note: “CLASS CANCELLED. THE FOLLOWING STUDENTS SEE PROF. DIRAC..." A list of names follows.
'The following students...' Shit, there I am...
Me too...
I hear Dirac wants us to cancel our plans for the weekend...
(horrified) What? .
That's not all... A couple of Biochemistry's finest are coming with us...
And someone to translate Latin...
Coming with us where? Nobody knows... As Walter turns and walks moodily away...
I'm going to have to pull some strings, here, this is just not gonna happen. I have serious plans for the weekend...
Four o'clock, Walter. Dirac's office... (turns to the ‘ others) I'll have to ditch Pagels again, e and he's not going to like it... (CONTINUED)
Sleep with him -- get your A...
(as she leaves) You're a wonderful person... Now Mullins drifts away too, as Brian smiles at Catherine
So what about your plans?
I was going to study, actually.
(relieved) Yeah, me too... I'm Brian Marsh, by the way, since we're spending the weekend together...
I know. Catherine Midwood.
I know.
as Brian and Catherine walk along, CAMERA DRIFTING WITH them...
Where did you transfer from?
Kneale. Theoretical Physics. I came here to study with Dirac. You're Applied Physics? (she nods) So why are you taking Dirac for theory?
I want to tknow what the math means.
Dirac's ruthless. He wants e philosophers, not scientists. (CONTINUED)
I read his books. He's a brilliant man...
They sit in a beautiful courtyard outside the Philosophy building...
Sounds mystical, doesn't it? Observer-created reality.

I started solving differential equations when I was a sophomore. At first it was just an exercise. Solve the math, no big deal. But then when I started to think about what all this math implied... Strange way to find out things aren't the way I thought they were...

Sometimes just as I think I've got it, visualized it -- it all goes away. I start seeing old-fashioned classical reality. I want the clockwork back. I want to put it all into a little box, but whenever I try, it slithers out... Brian reaches in his pocket, comes out with his deck of cards...
Some things aren't changed by quantum physics...
Such as?
Every theoretical physicist I know wonders why nobody who looks like you seems to ever settle down in our end of the building... (CONTINUED)
Sb
That's not true and that's an extremely sexist thing to say.

Confirmed sexist. Proud of it. (but now he sees that a wall has gone up around her) Hey, wait... I'm just teasing you... Brian tries to do the card trick. He screws it up again, the cards falling to the ground. He hopes she'll laugh. She doesn't.

What's the deal? You talk numbers, you get romantic. You talk people, you clam up. Catherine's jaw locks. She's tense and guarded, and yet she smiles. It's a social amenity she obviously doesn't feel...
Just a little miscue, that's all. It's not your fault. I'm sorry. I'11 see you later...
Look, this conversation is not what I had in mind at all. Can we just try this all again? Catherine looks at him, then relaxes, smiles...
Okay...
You see, I was hoping you needed more help with theory. So we could discuss it -- maybe over dinner or something, say...
With a confirmed sexist? (CONTINUED)
REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 16A.
(as he picks his cards up off the ground) Why not?
I suppose something could be arranged. There are other things I need help with -- over dinner... Now she's smiling at him. Brian puts the cards into his pocket... (CONTINUED)
on; Co 39 CONTINUED:
So maybe that wasn't a boyfriend or husband the other night?
Maybe.
Brian, Catherine, Walter, Kelly and Mullins are seated in front of Dirac...

I have volunteered our services to the archdiocese. Each of you is a competant physicist, even though you don't have a degree to prove it. (glances at Walter) Participating in this examination will greatly improve your classroom averages, I might add.
Walter looks sheepish...
Plan on eating your meals there. We'll bring cots to sleep on. There are other departments joining us...
‘Excuse me, sir. Is there a reason why you're not telling us what we're going to be doing?
(a beat as he looks at Brian) In time.
r Dirac stops in front of the abandoned church. He carrie a suitcase. (CONTINUED)

DIRAC'S POV: the ediface rising ominously into the blue sky. Dirac now glances over... DIRAC'S POV: down the street. A bus stop. A BAG LADY is seated, rigid, a petrified Pompeiian mummy with a mask like face. Her shopping cart full of yellowing newspapers and broken appliances sits nearby... Dirac, as he looks closer... CLOSER: the bag lady. She lifts her right arm slightly, from the elbow, in a strange salute -- and begins slowly rocking her head back and forth, over and over again... EXTREME CLOSE: across the dirty flesh of her cheek crawl a few ants...
LONG LENS. The moon is squashed, compressed and enlarged, hanging dead in the night sky behind the Los Angeles sky- line.
Dirac and the priest sit in an old office in the abandone church. Dirac has a cot set up in here, his clothes hang- ing out of the suitcase. It's dark, damp -- only low light from a couple lamps...

It your disbelief that powers him. It's your stubborn faith in common sense that allows his deception... It's hard to tell from Dirac's expression whether or not he fully believes all the priest is telling him.
He lives in the smallest parts of it. The atoms. Smaller. Invisible. He lives in all of it, the sum of the parts... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
You must translate the book. You must prove it scientifically, convince the outside world...
Outside world doesn't want to hear this kind of bullshit. Just keep it locked away -- you've already managed that for two thousand years...
No prison can keep him now.
Catherine comes out of the physics building, leaving from a late class. Brian is waiting outside for her...
Hi.
Getting cold out here. This is supposed to be California.
Did you have a class tonight?
Library. I was really hoping Maybe you'd have a cup of coffee with me again...
(smiles) This is getting to be a habit. (beat) Okay.

Early morning sunlight filters in through the faded curtains, cold and grey. Brian and Catherine are asleep in his bed, under the covers... CLOSER. Now Brian's eyes flicker and open. He carefully untangles himself from Catherine's arms and gets out of bed without waking her...

Brian emerges from his small apartment bungalow into the cold morning air. He glances off thoughtfully, filled wit excitement, going through his feelings... He looks up... BRIAN'S POV: the sun and moon, side by side, rising over the horizon... [EFFECT].
A FEW MINUTES LATER. Catherine opens her eyes, looks over Brian has made them both coffee... .
Good morning. She smiles at him sleepily.
We didn't get much sleep...
Who needs sleep?
We. do. Today's Friday. Brian comes over to her, kisses her tenderly...
Can I just tell you something?
Please don't.
I want to.
Tell me next time, if there is one -- or the time after that. Or two years from now... (CONTINUED)
ad 46
“PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 20A.
Who was he? The one who gave you such a high opinion of men? (CONTINUED)
REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 21.
Brian just looks at her...
I wouldn't like it if either of us jumped to conclusions.
How do you know I was going to say what you think I was going to say?
Because if you don't, I don't want to know... At which, he kisses her again...

A WIDE SHOT of the old church as a small van pulls up in front. CLOSER on the van, as Catherine, Kelly, LISA, 20s, Asian, a theologist, and SUSAN, 30s, a quiet student of Radiolog get out. They each carry over night bags and stand staring at the church. CLOSER ON Catherine and Kelly as Catherine looks where * Kelly indicates with a nod of her head. THEIR POV: across the street, by an alley, THREE STREET PEOPLE stand very still, silent, watching them...

A WIDE SHOT LOOKING TOWARD the front, the downtown L.A. * skyline in b.g. CAMERA PANS WITH the van as it moves past, revealing Dirac overseeing the beginnning of the careful unloading of the trucks in the rear of the church. Brian, Mullins, CALDER, 20s, a Microbiology major, and WYNDHAM, 30s, a biochemist, begin downloading scientific equipment.
A large, empty storeroom has been turned into the Women's Sleeping Quarters. Cots line the walls. The girls enter from a hall... (CONTINUED)
C 2ia.
Please don't tell me... They put their overnight bags down, look around.
This place gives me the creeps.
It was abandoned...
I'd have never guessed.
I hear it used to be a beautiful church...
When?
1953. My husband's parents used to come here. Then for some reason it was closed down...

An old sanctuary on the second floor is being turned into a make-shift scientific lab. Equipment is wheeled in a doorway by Brian and Walter. Wyndham sets up a chemistry lab over on a large table. Mullins sets up a computer.
An empty office. Funky. Bookshelves. Catherine sets up a computer, plugs it in...

As Walter carries a roll of electrical cable out of the sanctuary, comes to the end, hooks it up to another roll held by LOMAX, 30s, from the Engineering Dept. Brian has stopped by a broken window and looks out...
I really can't believe this is happening. I had a date tonight with this beautiful young trial attorney from Century City...
Where were you taking him?
Please, it isn't funny. Now Walter glances out the window... WALTER'S POV: the front of the church. Now see FIVE MORE STREET PEOPLE standing there, not moving, staring back at the church...
What are they doing?
Watching us. They started coming around when I got here at 9 this morning... : (CONTINUED)
54 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" = 4/25/87 23.
Calder and Wyndham come up the stairs...
I'm Calder -- Microbiology.
John Wyndham. Biochemistry. They all shake hands.
Brian Marsh.
Walter Fong.
Lomax. Engineering.
Anybody know what this whole deal's about yet?
Not a clue.
CLOSE: the old book, as it's opened to the first page of Latin. Dirac stands behind Lisa. She's very self-assured, capabl at her computer terminal.

I'mgetting my doctorate in theology. Analysis of ancient scriptures. This shouldn't be too difficult... She stares at the Latin text a moment, then begins typing each phrase from the book into the computer... CLOSE: Lisa's computer screen: "I, JESUS, HAVE SENT MINE

head_text.subj: ANGEL TO TESTIFY UNTO YOU THIS THING WHICH SHALL BE BE UN

text: In b.g. is the church. In f.g. is an abandoned car. Crawling across the hood are spiders by the hundreds. (CONTINUED)

A limousine pulls up in front of the church. The priest gets out, walks, stops a moment, looking around... CLOSE: the priest. His eyes Look up... UP ANGLE: the spires of the church. Up there in the sky is the impossible alignment: moon over sun, in broad day- light... [EFFECT] CLOSE: the priest, now glances down... HIS POV: down the street 2 BAG LADIES stand watching him. The priest, starts to walk forward, steps right into a da shape standing on the sidewalk in front of him! It's the Bag Lady Dirac saw days earlier. Her eyes are bright, glistening. She holds a small paper cup in her hand.

It's a wonderful thing you're doing -- opening the church again... The priest nods, starts by her, glances in the paper cup. 5 HIS POV: the paper cup has a strange dark substance at th bottom, like dried meat, and it is filled with maggots...
The priest closes the front doors. Dirac comes up behind him quietly, watches the priest tremble...
Are you all right?
Yes...
We're ready.
The priest leads Dirac, Brian, Walter and Lomax to the hu iron door...
r «+. as they descend...
REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 25.
... as Lomax strings out more cable down the dank corrido around a corner into the strange cross-lined hallway up t a portable generator...

SEVERAL CUTS: as many small floor lights on stands, like H.M.I. lights, BUZZ ON, flooding the underground church with light. : The group stands in silence staring up toward the front of the church... Only Susan and Lisa are absent... THEIR POV: the canister of ghostly, glowing, swaying liqu looking very much as if it's living...
CLOSE: computer screen. "MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE

head_text.subj: MOTHER OF HARLOTS, AND THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH..."

text: Lisa stares at what she's just written, a kind of formles dread beginning inside her...

CLOSE: computer screen, as mathematical data spews across it. Arcane, impossible differential equations... Catherine types the figures into the computer from hand- written notes. She looks over the top of the screen... CATHERINE'S POV: the window. Massing, swarming, leaping and flying up against the glass are nearly 100 moths! They flutter fur: ously in’ into one another, trying to g through ‘the glass barrier...
Kelly is staring at the canister as Brian and Walter hook up a bizarre-looking piece of equipment next to it...
There's a good reason why nobody's opened this thing, right?
Because we don't know what's in it. Let me have your pen for a second... (CONTINUED)
Cy 62 CONTINUED: She gives him a fountain pen which he uses to delicately probe the innards of the equipment.
Is this some kind of toxic crap?
Could be...

Okay, but I still don't understand why we're not taking direct samples. What's the big mystery? Brian gets up, goes over to a small computer terminal nea by, punches a couple keys, calls up line after line of ma blipping across the screen...
Catherine's entering these equations upstairs. They're sii, translated from Latin...
Differential equations?
In a book written two thousand years ago...
But we hadn't invented differ...
Right. Kelly and Walter exchange glances, and then Kelly turns t leave. She bumps her arm against one of the stanchions that holds a large cross...

as Mullins accompanies Catherine quickly into the room, She's showing him... THEIR POV: now the window is completely covered with moth e@ 64 INT. CUBICLE Lisa translates Latin, as Dirac stands behind her watchin (CONTINUED)
CLOSE: computer screen. "AND THE PRINCE OF DARKNESS WAS

head_text.subj: HIMSELF SEALED, THAT OLD LIFE, CALLED THE DEVIL, AND
SATAN, WHICH DECEIVETH THE WHOLE WORLD..."

text: Lisa and Dirac, as she stops typing, looks at him... As Susan, the radiologist, comes into the room with some x-rays in her hand...
Professor Dirac -- I don't think we have too much to worry about. The lid on that thing won't open. Dirac takes the x-rays, looks at them up against the ligh
It's incredibly elaborate. There's a weird locking mechanism. Looks like it can only be opened from the inside...
Lights on in a couple halls, rear windows. A slight breeze. And suddenly the dark shape of a TATTERED BAG MAN steps into frame f.g., moving slowly past the church, watching...
Another old office has been made into a lounge of sorts. Lots .of opened Pizza Man and Chinese food boxes. An ice chest, soft. drink cans spread around, ash trays, etc. (CONTINUED)
REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" ~ 4/25/87 28.

Walter sits drinking coffee, staring grumpily at a portable TV set someone was thoughtful enough to bring... WALTER'S POV: the TV. A cartoon is on. An old Tom and Jerry, the one where Tom is sent to Hell. A bulldog Devil with horns, cape and pitchfork cavorts in the fire and brimstone... Walter gets up, glances at Kelly standing at the window. She's rubbing her arm...
I'm going back.
